item.title: Restoring Large MySQL Dump
item.description: Yesterday I had a fun opportunity of restoring roughly 912 Million Rows to a database. 902 Million belonged to one single table (902,966,645 rows, to be exact). Problem Our current backup system uses mysqldump. It dumps a 25 GB sql dump file, which compresses to about 2.5GB using gzip. The last time we needed to restore a backup it was only about 9GB, and it took several hours. This time, I created the database, and from the mysql prompt I issued the following command:
